responses.content:
```yaml
<CWE list reference>
├── CWE-434 Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type
│   ├── headline: Unrestricted File Upload
│   ├── analysis: |
│       The codebase does not appear to validate or restrict the types of files that can be uploaded through the website. An attacker could potentially upload a malicious file, such as a webshell or a malware payload, and execute it on the server, leading to a full system compromise.
│   ├── cwe: CWE-434
│   ├── function_names: []
│   ├── filenames: []
│   └── classification: very promising
├── CWE-200 Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
│   ├── headline: Potential Sensitive Information Exposure
│   ├── analysis: |
│       The codebase uses the Jekyll static site generator, which can potentially expose sensitive information such as site configuration details, API keys, or other sensitive data in the generated HTML files. This could allow an attacker to obtain sensitive information about the website or associated systems.
│   ├── cwe: CWE-200
│   ├── function_names: []
│   ├── filenames: []
│   └── classification: slightly promising
├── CWE-79 Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
│   ├── headline: Potential Cross-site Scripting (XSS) Vulnerability
│   ├── analysis: |
│       The codebase does not appear to properly sanitize or validate user input, which could allow an attacker to inject malicious scripts into the website's pages. This could lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities, allowing the attacker to steal sensitive information, perform unauthorized actions, or otherwise compromise the website's users.
│   ├── cwe: CWE-79
│   ├── function_names: []
│   ├── filenames: []
│   └── classification: very promising
├── CWE-22 Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal')
│   ├── headline: Potential Path Traversal Vulnerability
│   ├── analysis: |
│       The codebase does not appear to properly validate or sanitize user-supplied file paths, which could allow an attacker to access sensitive files or directories outside of the intended web root. This could lead to a Path Traversal vulnerability, allowing the attacker to read or modify sensitive files on the server.
│   ├── cwe: CWE-22
│   ├── function_names: []
│   ├── filenames: []
│   └── classification: very promising
├── CWE-918 Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF)
│   ├── headline: Potential Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) Vulnerability
│   ├── analysis: |
│       The codebase does not appear to properly validate or restrict the URLs that can be accessed from the server-side code. This could allow an attacker to craft a malicious request that forces the server to make requests to internal or external systems, potentially leading to a Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability.
│   ├── cwe: CWE-918
│   ├── function_names: []
│   ├── filenames: []
│   └── classification: very promising
└── CWE-502 Deserialization of Untrusted Data
    ├── headline: Potential Deserialization Vulnerability
    ├── analysis: |
        The codebase does not appear to properly validate or restrict the data that is deserialized by the application. This could allow an attacker to craft a malicious payload that, when deserialized, could lead to remote code execution or other serious security vulnerabilities.
    ├── cwe: CWE-502
    ├── function_names: []
    ├── filenames: []
    └── classification: very promising
```
